00006 void
00007 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::ctor(ByteOrder sex, const Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk *disk)

00048     host_to_disk(sex, p_sh_info,      &(disk->sh_info));

00070 
00072 void
00073 SgAsmElfSectionTable::ctor()
00074 {
00075     /* There can be only one ELF Section Table */
00076     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00077     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr);
00078     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_section_table()==NULL);
00079 
00080     set_synthesized(true);                              /* the section table isn't really a section itself */
00081     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("ELF Section Table"));
00082     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00083 
00084     /* Every section table has a first entry that's all zeros. We don't declare that section here (see parse()) but we do set
00085      * the section count in the header in order to reserve that first slot. */
00086     if (fhdr->get_e_shnum()<1)
00087         fhdr->set_e_shnum(1);
00088 
00089     fhdr->set_section_table(this);
00090 }
00091     
00094 SgAsmElfSectionTable *
00095 SgAsmElfSectionTable::parse()
00096 {
00097     SgAsmGenericSection::parse();
00098 
00099     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00100     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00101     ByteOrder sex = fhdr->get_sex();
00102 
00103     size_t ent_size, struct_size, opt_size, nentries;
00104     calculate_sizes(&ent_size, &struct_size, &opt_size, &nentries);
00105     ROSE_ASSERT(opt_size==fhdr->get_shextrasz() && nentries==fhdr->get_e_shnum());
00106 
00107     /* If the current size is very small (0 or 1 byte) then we're coming straight from the constructor and the parsing should
00108      * also extend this section to hold all the entries. Otherwise the caller must have assigned a specific size for a good
00109      * reason and we should leave that alone, reading zeros if the entries extend beyond the defined size. */
00110     if (get_size()<=1 && get_size()<nentries*ent_size)
00111         extend(nentries*ent_size - get_size());
00112 
00113     /* Read all the section headers. */
00114     std::vector<SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry*> entries;
00115     rose_addr_t offset = 0;
00116     for (size_t i=0; i<nentries; i++, offset+=ent_size) {
00117         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *shdr = NULL;
00118         if (4 == fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00119             SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk disk;
00120             read_content_local(offset, &disk, struct_size);
00121             shdr = new SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry(sex, &disk);
00122         } else {
00123             SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk disk;
00124             read_content_local(offset, &disk, struct_size);
00125             shdr = new SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry(sex, &disk);
00126         }
00127         if (opt_size>0)
00128             shdr->get_extra() = read_content_local_ucl(offset+struct_size, opt_size);
00129         entries.push_back(shdr);
00130     }
00131 
00132     /* This vector keeps track of which sections have already been parsed. We could get the same information by calling
00133      * fhdr->get_section_by_id() and passing the entry number since entry numbers and IDs are one and the same in ELF. However,
00134      * this is a bit easier. */
00135     std::vector<SgAsmElfSection*> is_parsed;
00136     is_parsed.resize(entries.size(), NULL);
00137 
00138     /* All sections implicitly depend on the section string table for their names. */
00139     SgAsmElfStringSection *section_name_strings=NULL;
00140     if (fhdr->get_e_shstrndx() > 0) {
00141         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *entry = entries[fhdr->get_e_shstrndx()];
00142         section_name_strings = new SgAsmElfStringSection(fhdr);
00143         section_name_strings->init_from_section_table(entry, section_name_strings, fhdr->get_e_shstrndx());
00144         section_name_strings->parse();
00145         is_parsed[fhdr->get_e_shstrndx()] = section_name_strings;
00146     }
00147 
00148     /* Read all the sections. Some sections depend on other sections, so we read them in such an order that all dependencies
00149      * are satisfied first. */
00150     while (1) {
00151         bool try_again=false;
00152         for (size_t i=0; i<entries.size(); i++) {
00153             SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *entry = entries[i];
00154             ROSE_ASSERT(entry->get_sh_link()<entries.size());
00155 
00156             /* Some sections might reference another section through the sh_link member. */
00157             bool need_linked = entry->get_sh_link() > 0;
00158             ROSE_ASSERT(!need_linked || entry->get_sh_link()<entries.size());
00159             SgAsmElfSection *linked = need_linked ? is_parsed[entry->get_sh_link()] : NULL;
00160 
00161             /* Relocation sections might have a second linked section stored in sh_info. */
00162             bool need_info_linked = (entry->get_sh_type() == SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_REL ||
00163                                      entry->get_sh_type() == SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_RELA) &&
00164                                     entry->get_sh_info() > 0;
00165             ROSE_ASSERT(!need_info_linked || entry->get_sh_info()<entries.size());
00166             SgAsmElfSection *info_linked = need_info_linked ? is_parsed[entry->get_sh_info()] : NULL;
00167 
00168             if (is_parsed[i]) {
00169                 /* This section has already been parsed. */
00170             } else if ((need_linked && !linked) || (need_info_linked && !info_linked)) {
00171                 /* Don't parse this section yet because it depends on something that's not parsed yet. */
00172                 try_again = true;
00173             } else {
00174                 switch (entry->get_sh_type()) {
00175                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_NULL:
00176                         /* Null entry. We still create the section just to hold the section header. */
00177                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00178                         break;
00179                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_NOBITS:
00180                         /* These types of sections don't occupy any file space (e.g., BSS) */
00181                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00182                         break;
00183                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_DYNAMIC: {
00184                         SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(linked);
00185                         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00186                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfDynamicSection(fhdr, strsec);
00187                         break;
00188                     }
00189                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_DYNSYM: {
00190                         SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(linked);
00191                         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00192                         SgAsmElfSymbolSection *symsec = new SgAsmElfSymbolSection(fhdr, strsec);
00193                         symsec->set_is_dynamic(true);
00194                         is_parsed[i] = symsec;
00195                         break;
00196                     }
00197                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_SYMTAB: {
00198                         SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(linked);
00199                         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00200                         SgAsmElfSymbolSection *symsec = new SgAsmElfSymbolSection(fhdr, strsec);
00201                         symsec->set_is_dynamic(false);
00202                         is_parsed[i] = symsec;
00203                         break;
00204                     }
00205                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_STRTAB:
00206                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfStringSection(fhdr);
00207                         break;
00208                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_REL: {
00209                         SgAsmElfSymbolSection *symbols = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSymbolSection*>(linked);
00210                         SgAsmElfRelocSection *relocsec = new SgAsmElfRelocSection(fhdr, symbols, info_linked);
00211                         relocsec->set_uses_addend(false);
00212                         is_parsed[i] = relocsec;
00213                         break;
00214                     }
00215                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_RELA: {
00216                         SgAsmElfSymbolSection *symbols = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSymbolSection*>(linked);
00217                         SgAsmElfRelocSection *relocsec = new SgAsmElfRelocSection(fhdr, symbols, info_linked);
00218                         relocsec->set_uses_addend(true);
00219                         is_parsed[i] = relocsec;
00220                         break;
00221                     }
00222                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_PROGBITS: {
00223                         if (!section_name_strings) {
00224                             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmElfSectionTable::parse(): no string table for section table\n");
00225                             is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00226                         } else {
00227                             std::string section_name = section_name_strings->read_content_local_str(entry->get_sh_name());
00228                             if (section_name == ".eh_frame") {
00229                                 is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfEHFrameSection(fhdr);
00230                             } else {
00231                                 is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00232                             }
00233                         }
00234                         break;
00235                     }
00236                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_GNU_versym: {
00237                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSymverSection(fhdr);
00238                         break;
00239                     }
00240                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_GNU_verdef: {
00241                         SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(linked);
00242                         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00243                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSymverDefinedSection(fhdr,strsec);
00244                         break;
00245                     }
00246                     case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_GNU_verneed: {
00247                         SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(linked);
00248                         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00249                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSymverNeededSection(fhdr,strsec);
00250                         break;
00251                     }
00252                     default:
00253                         is_parsed[i] = new SgAsmElfSection(fhdr);
00254                         break;
00255                 }
00256                 is_parsed[i]->init_from_section_table(entry, section_name_strings, i);
00257                 is_parsed[i]->parse();
00258             }
00259         }
00260         if (!try_again)
00261             break;
00262     }
00263 
00264     /* Initialize links between sections */
00265     for (size_t i = 0; i < entries.size(); i++) {
00266         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *shdr = entries[i];
00267         if (shdr->get_sh_link() > 0) {
00268             SgAsmElfSection *source = isSgAsmElfSection(fhdr->get_file()->get_section_by_id(i));
00269             SgAsmElfSection *target = isSgAsmElfSection(fhdr->get_file()->get_section_by_id(shdr->get_sh_link()));
00270             assert(source);     /* because we created it above */
00271             source->set_linked_section(target);
00272         }
00273     }
00274 
00275     /* Finish parsing sections now that we have basic info for all the sections. */
00276     for (size_t i=0; i<is_parsed.size(); i++)
00277         is_parsed[i]->finish_parsing();
00278 
00279     return this;
00280 }
00281 
00290 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *
00291 SgAsmElfSectionTable::add_section(SgAsmElfSection *section)
00292 {
00293     ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00294     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_file()==get_file());
00295     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_header()==get_header());
00296     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_section_entry()==NULL);            /* must not be in the section table yet */
00297     
00298     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00299     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00300 
00301     /* Assign an ID if there isn't one yet */
00302     if (section->get_id()<0) {
00303         int id = fhdr->get_e_shnum();
00304         fhdr->set_e_shnum(id+1);
00305         section->set_id(id);
00306     }
00307 
00308     /* If the supplied section is a string table and the ELF Section Table doesn't have a string table associated with it yet,
00309      * then use the supplied section as the string table to hold the names of the sections. When this happens, all sections
00310      * that are already defined in the ELF Section Table should have their names moved into the new string table. */
00311     SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec = NULL;
00312     if (fhdr->get_e_shstrndx()==0) {
00313         strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(section);
00314         if (strsec) {
00315             fhdr->set_e_shstrndx(section->get_id());
00316             SgAsmGenericSectionList *all = fhdr->get_sections();
00317             for (size_t i=0; i<all->get_sections().size(); i++) {
00318                 SgAsmElfSection *s = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(all->get_sections()[i]);
00319                 if (s && s->get_id()>=0 && s->get_section_entry()!=NULL) {
00320                     s->allocate_name_to_storage(strsec);
00321                 }
00322             }
00323         }
00324     } else {
00325         strsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfStringSection*>(fhdr->get_section_by_id(fhdr->get_e_shstrndx()));
00326         ROSE_ASSERT(strsec!=NULL);
00327     }
00328 
00329     /* Make sure the name is in the correct string table */
00330     if (strsec)
00331         section->allocate_name_to_storage(strsec);
00332 
00333     /* Create a new section table entry. */
00334     SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *shdr = new SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry;
00335     shdr->update_from_section(section);
00336     section->set_section_entry(shdr);
00337 
00338     return shdr;
00339 }
00340 
00342 void
00343 SgAsmElfSection::allocate_name_to_storage(SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec)
00344 {
00345     if (get_name()) {
00346         SgAsmStoredString *old_stored = dynamic_cast<SgAsmStoredString*>(get_name());
00347         if (!old_stored || old_stored->get_strtab()!=strsec->get_strtab()) {
00348             /* Reallocate string to new string table */
00349             SgAsmStoredString *new_stored = new SgAsmStoredString(strsec->get_strtab(), 0);
00350             new_stored->set_string(get_name()->get_string());
00351             get_name()->set_string(""); /*free old string*/
00352             set_name(new_stored);
00353         }
00354     }
00355 }
00356 
00359 rose_addr_t
00360 SgAsmElfSectionTable::calculate_sizes(size_t *entsize, size_t *required, size_t *optional, size_t *entcount) const
00361 {
00362     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00363     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00364 
00365     size_t struct_size = 0;
00366     size_t extra_size = fhdr->get_shextrasz();
00367     size_t entry_size = 0;
00368     size_t nentries = 0;
00369 
00370     /* Size of required part of each entry */
00371     if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00372         struct_size = sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk);
00373     } else if (8==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00374         struct_size = sizeof(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk);
00375     } else {
00376         throw FormatError("bad ELF word size");
00377     }
00378 
00379     /* Entire entry should be at least large enough for the required part. */
00380     entry_size = struct_size;
00381 
00382     /* Size of optional parts. If we've parsed the table then use the largest optional part, otherwise assume the entry from
00383      * the ELF File Header is correct. */
00384     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_sections()->get_sections();
00385     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++) {
00386         SgAsmElfSection *elfsec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00387         if (elfsec && elfsec->get_section_entry()) {
00388             ROSE_ASSERT(elfsec->get_id()>=0);
00389             nentries = std::max(nentries, (size_t)elfsec->get_id()+1);
00390             extra_size = std::max(extra_size, elfsec->get_section_entry()->get_extra().size());
00391         }
00392     }
00393 
00394     /* Total number of entries. Either we haven't parsed the section table yet (nor created the sections it defines) or we
00395      * have. In the former case we use the setting from the ELF File Header. Otherwise the table has to be large enough to
00396      * store the section with the largest ID (ID also serves as the index into the ELF Section Table). */
00397     if (0==nentries)
00398         nentries = fhdr->get_e_shnum();
00399 
00400     /* Return values */
00401     if (entsize)
00402         *entsize = entry_size;
00403     if (required)
00404         *required = struct_size;
00405     if (optional)
00406         *optional = extra_size;
00407     if (entcount)
00408         *entcount = nentries;
00409     return entry_size * nentries;
00410 }
00411 
00413 void
00414 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::update_from_section(SgAsmElfSection *section)
00415 {
00416     if (section->get_name()->get_offset()==SgAsmGenericString::unallocated) {
00417         p_sh_name = 0; /*not a stored string after all*/
00418     } else {
00419         p_sh_name = section->get_name()->get_offset();
00420     }
00421 
00422     set_sh_offset(section->get_offset());
00423     if (get_sh_type()==SHT_NOBITS && section->is_mapped()) {
00424         set_sh_size(section->get_mapped_size());
00425     } else {
00426         set_sh_size(section->get_size());
00427     }
00428 
00429     if (section->is_mapped()) {
00430         set_sh_addr(section->get_mapped_preferred_rva());
00431         set_sh_addralign(section->get_mapped_alignment());
00432         if (section->get_mapped_wperm()) {
00433             p_sh_flags |= SHF_WRITE;
00434         } else {
00435             p_sh_flags &= ~SHF_WRITE;
00436         }
00437         if (section->get_mapped_xperm()) {
00438             p_sh_flags |=  SHF_EXECINSTR;
00439         } else {
00440             p_sh_flags &= ~SHF_EXECINSTR;
00441         }
00442     } else {
00443         set_sh_addr(0);
00444         p_sh_flags &= ~(SHF_WRITE | SHF_EXECINSTR); /*clear write & execute bits*/
00445     }
00446     
00447     SgAsmElfSection *linked_to = section->get_linked_section();
00448     if (linked_to) {
00449         ROSE_ASSERT(linked_to->get_id()>0);
00450         set_sh_link(linked_to->get_id());
00451     } else {
00452         set_sh_link(0);
00453     }
00454 }
00455 
00457 std::string
00458 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::to_string(SectionType t)
00459 {
00460 #ifndef _MSC_VER
00461     std::string retval = stringifySgAsmElfSectionTableEntrySectionType(t);
00462 #else
00463         ROSE_ASSERT(false);
00464         std::string retval = "";
00465 #endif
00466         if ('('!=retval[0])
00467         return retval;
00468     
00469     char buf[128];
00470     if(t>=SHT_LOOS && t <= SHT_HIOS) {
00471         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"os-specific (%zu)",size_t(t)) ;
00472         return buf;
00473     }
00474     if (t>=SHT_LOPROC && t<=SHT_HIPROC) {
00475         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"processor-specific (%zu)",size_t(t)) ;
00476         return buf;
00477     }
00478     if (t>=SHT_LOUSER && t<=SHT_HIUSER) {
00479         snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"application-specific (%zu)",size_t(t)) ;
00480         return buf;
00481     }
00482     snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"unknown section type (%zu)",size_t(t)) ;
00483     return buf;
00484 }
00485 
00486 std::string
00487 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::to_string(SectionFlags val)
00488 {
00489   std::string str;
00490   static const uint32_t kBaseMask=0x3ff;
00491   for( size_t i=0; (1u <<i) <= SHF_TLS; ++i){
00492     if( i!= 0)
00493       str += ' ';
00494     if(val & (1 << i)){
00495       switch(1 << i){
00496         case SHF_NULL:      str += "NULL";break;
00497         case SHF_WRITE:     str += "WRITE";break;
00498         case SHF_ALLOC:     str += "ALLOC";break;
00499         case SHF_EXECINSTR: str +=  "CODE";break;
00500         case SHF_MERGE:     str += "MERGE";break;
00501         case SHF_STRINGS:   str += "STRINGS";break;
00502         case SHF_INFO_LINK: str += "INFO_LINK";break;
00503         case SHF_LINK_ORDER:str += "LINK_ORDER";break;
00504         case SHF_OS_NONCONFORMING:str += "OS SPECIAL";break;
00505         case SHF_GROUP:     str += "GROUP";break;
00506         case SHF_TLS:       str += "TLS";break;
00507       };
00508     }
00509   }
00510   uint32_t os   = (val & ~(uint32_t)(SHF_MASKOS));
00511   uint32_t proc = (val & ~(uint32_t)(SHF_MASKPROC));
00512   uint32_t rest = (val & ~(uint32_t)(kBaseMask | SHF_MASKOS | SHF_MASKPROC));
00513 
00514   if(os){
00515     char buf[64];
00516     snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"os flags(%2x)", os >> 20);
00517     str += buf;    
00518   }
00519 
00520   if(proc){
00521     char buf[64];
00522     snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"proc flags(%1x)", proc >> 28);
00523     str += buf;    
00524   }
00525 
00526   if(rest){
00527     char buf[64];
00528     snprintf(buf,sizeof(buf),"unknown(%x)", rest);
00529     str += buf;
00530   }
00531 
00532   return str;
00533 }
00534 
00536 void
00537 SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00538 {
00539     char p[4096];
00540     if (idx>=0) {
00541         sprintf(p, "%sElfSectionTableEntry[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00542     } else {
00543         sprintf(p, "%sElfSectionTableEntry.", prefix);
00544     }
00545     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00546     
00547     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u bytes into strtab\n",                      p, w, "sh_name",        p_sh_name);
00548     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%x (%d) %s\n",                              p, w, "sh_type", 
00549             p_sh_type, p_sh_type, to_string(p_sh_type).c_str());
00550     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                                       p, w, "sh_link",        p_sh_link);
00551     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu\n",                                       p, w, "sh_info",        p_sh_info);
00552     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64"\n",                             p, w, "sh_flags",       p_sh_flags);
00553     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n",                 p, w, "sh_addr",        p_sh_addr, p_sh_addr);
00554     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes into file\n", p, w, "sh_offset",      p_sh_offset, p_sh_offset);
00555     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "sh_size",        p_sh_size, p_sh_size);
00556     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "sh_addralign",   p_sh_addralign, p_sh_addralign);
00557     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "sh_entsize",     p_sh_entsize, p_sh_entsize);
00558     if (p_extra.size()>0) {
00559         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %zu bytes\n", p, w, "extra", p_extra.size());
00560         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"extra at ", p_extra);
00561     }
00562 }
00563 
00564 
00566 bool
00567 SgAsmElfSectionTable::reallocate()
00568 {
00569     bool reallocated = false;
00570 
00571     /* Resize based on word size from ELF File Header */
00572     size_t opt_size, nentries;
00573     rose_addr_t need = calculate_sizes(NULL, NULL, &opt_size, &nentries);
00574     if (need < get_size()) {
00575         if (is_mapped()) {
00576             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00577             set_mapped_size(need);
00578         }
00579         set_size(need);
00580         reallocated = true;
00581         
00582     } else if (need > get_size()) {
00583         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00584         reallocated = true;
00585     }
00586 
00587     /* Update data members in the ELF File Header. No need to return true for these changes. */
00588     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00589     fhdr->set_shextrasz(opt_size);
00590     fhdr->set_e_shnum(nentries);
00591 
00592     return reallocated;
00593 }
00594 
00596 void
00597 SgAsmElfSectionTable::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00598 {
00599     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());
00600     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00601     ByteOrder sex = fhdr->get_sex();
00602     SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList sections = fhdr->get_sectab_sections();
00603 
00604     /* Write the sections first */
00605     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); i++)
00606         sections[i]->unparse(f);
00607     unparse_holes(f);
00608 
00609     /* Calculate sizes. The ELF File Header should have been updated in reallocate() prior to unparsing. */
00610     size_t ent_size, struct_size, opt_size, nentries;
00611     calculate_sizes(&ent_size, &struct_size, &opt_size, &nentries);
00612     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_shextrasz()==opt_size);
00613     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr->get_e_shnum()==nentries);
00614     
00615     /* Write the section table entries */
00616     for (size_t i=0; i<sections.size(); ++i) {
00617         SgAsmElfSection *section = dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfSection*>(sections[i]);
00618         ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL);
00619         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *shdr = section->get_section_entry();
00620         ROSE_ASSERT(shdr!=NULL);
00621         ROSE_ASSERT(shdr->get_sh_offset()==section->get_offset());/*section table entry should have been updated in reallocate()*/
00622 
00623         int id = section->get_id();
00624         ROSE_ASSERT(id>=0 && (size_t)id<nentries);
00625 
00626         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf32SectionTableEntry_disk disk32;
00627         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::Elf64SectionTableEntry_disk disk64;
00628         void *disk  = NULL;
00629 
00630         if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00631             disk = shdr->encode(sex, &disk32);
00632         } else if (8==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00633             disk = shdr->encode(sex, &disk64);
00634         } else {
00635             ROSE_ASSERT(!"invalid word size");
00636         }
00637 
00638         /* The disk struct */
00639         rose_addr_t spos = write(f, id*ent_size, struct_size, disk);
00640         if (shdr->get_extra().size() > 0) {
00641             ROSE_ASSERT(shdr->get_extra().size()<=opt_size);
00642             write(f, spos, shdr->get_extra());
00643         }
00644     }
00645 }
00646 
00648 void
00649 SgAsmElfSectionTable::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00650 {
00651     char p[4096];
00652     if (idx>=0) {
00653         sprintf(p, "%sSectionTable[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00654     } else {
00655         sprintf(p, "%sSectionTable.", prefix);
00656     }
00657 
00658     SgAsmGenericSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00659 
00660     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmElfSectionTable) //unless a base class
00661         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00662 }
